title: Noninvasive Brain Stimulation in Mild Cognitive Impairment and Dementia
description_brief: The research objective of this study is to examine the efficacy of HD-tDCS to the preSMA/DACC region and its influence on verbal episodic memory in patients with MCI or dementia after 10 sessions of HD-tDCS. There will be three treatment arms: two active HD-tDCS (1 mA or 2 mA) and a sham group. A verbal episodic memory task will be completed at baseline, immediately following the last HD-tDCS session, and a 2-month follow-up.
description_detailed: This is a pilot study being done to attempt to improve verbal episodic memory in persons with mild cognitive impairment (MCI) and dementia. Although the hippocampus is a brain structure most often associated with early deficits in MCI and dementia, the pre-supplemental motor area (preSMA) and dorsal anterior cingulate cortex (DACC) have been shown to play a role in verbal episodic memory for such patients. The purpose of this study is to examine the efficacy of high-definition transcranial direct current stimulation (HD-tDCS) to the preSMA/DACC region and its influence on verbal episodic memory in patients with MCI and dementia. Entraining the preSMA/DACC circuit with 10 sessions at one of two levels of HD-tDCS will allow the researchers to investigate whether neuromodulation may be used to improve verbal episodic memory. Participants will receive 10 sessions at one of two levels of active stimulation (1 mA or 2 mA anodal HD-tDCS targeting preSMA/DACC for 20 min) or sham across 2 weeks. The device is used to deliver high definition transcranial direct current stimulation to targeted regions. A verbal episodic memory task will be completed at baseline, immediately following the last HD-tDCS session, and a 2-month follow-up. The investigators plan to recruit English-speaking participants aged 50 years and older with MCI and dementia. Participants will be randomized into HD-tDCS conditions.

groups.title: Sham Group
groups.description:
Participants will receive sham HD-tDCS for 20 minutes, meaning no stimulation.

Sham Transcranial direct current stimulation (STARStim 8): Participants wear a neoprene cap on their head and electrodes filled with gel are attached and will deliver no current to the scalp.

groups.title: Active Stimulation at 1mA
groups.description:
Participants will receive 1 mA active HD-tDCS for 20 minutes.

Active Transcranial direct current stimulation (STARStim 8): Participants wear a neoprene cap on their head and electrodes filled with gel are attached and will deliver 1mA to the scalp.

groups.title: Active Stimulation at 2mA
groups.description:
Participants will receive 2 mA active HD-tDCS for 20 minutes.

Active Transcranial direct current stimulation (STARStim 8): Participants wear a neoprene cap on their head and electrodes filled with gel are attached and will deliver 2mA to the scalp.

baselineCharacteristicsModule.populationDescription: Participants with mild cognitive impairment were not analyzed given the limited numbers that were recruited, allocated to treatment, and with data on outcome measures.

groups.title: Sham Group
groups.description: sham HD-tDCS for 20 minutes, meaning no stimulation.

categories.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Score on the Rey Auditory Verbal Learning Test (RAVLT)
outcomeMeasures.description: The RAVLT is a verbal episodic memory task where a list of 15 words is read aloud for 5 consecutive trials followed by a 20 minute delayed recall trial. The number of items recalled immediately after each trial are summed to create a total learning score, ranging from 0-75. Also, the number of items recalled for the delayed trial are recorded as a delayed recall score, ranging from 0-15. Scores were converted to standardized scores (T-scores) using normative data, ranging from 2-86. Higher scores reflect better episodic memory performance. Changes from baseline for the total learning and delayed recall scores at the last HD-tDCS session and the 2-month follow-up will be measured as the primary outcomes.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Baseline, immediately following last treatment session, and 2-months post treatment

groups.title: Sham Group
groups.description: sham HD-tDCS for 20 minutes, meaning no stimulation.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Score on the Brief Visuospatial Memory Test-Revised (BVMT-R)
outcomeMeasures.description: The BVMT-R is a visual episodic memory task where 6 simple designs are shown for 10 seconds in a 2 x 3 matrix for 3 learning trials followed by a 25-minute delayed recall trial. The number of items recalled immediately after each trial are summed to create a total learning score, ranging from 0-36. Also, the number of items recalled for the delayed trial are recorded as a delayed recall score, ranging from 0-12. Scores were converted to standardized scores (T-scores) using normative data, ranging from 2-86. Higher scores reflect better visual episodic memory performance. Changes from baseline for the total learning and delayed recall scores at the last HD-tDCS session and the 2-month follow-up will be measured.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Baseline, immediately following last treatment session, and 2-months post treatment

groups.title: Sham Group
groups.description: sham HD-tDCS for 20 minutes, meaning no stimulation.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Score on the Boston Naming Test Short Form
outcomeMeasures.description: The Boston Naming Test Short Form is a 30 item version of the task (odd and even item versions of the full test) and a measure of language. The subject is shown pictures of objects and is required to correctly name them as quickly as possible. The outcome measure for this task is the total number of correct responses, ranging from 0-30. Scores were converted to standardized scores (T-scores) using normative data, ranging from 2-86. Higher scores reflect better performance. Changes from baseline to the last HD-tDCS session and the 2-month follow-up will be measured.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Baseline, immediately following last treatment session, and 2-months post treatment

groups.title: Sham Group
groups.description: sham HD-tDCS for 20 minutes, meaning no stimulation.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Score on the Delis Kaplan Executive Function System (DKEFS) Phonemic Fluency
outcomeMeasures.description: The DKEFS phonemic verbal fluency task is a measure of language. The subject is required to name as many words as possible that begin with specified letters within 1 minute. Three different letter trials are completed. The outcome measure for this task is the total number of correct responses across the trials, ranging from 0-90. Scores were converted to standardized scores (T-scores) using normative data, ranging from 2-86. Higher scores reflect better performance. Changes from baseline to the last HD-tDCS session and the 2-month follow-up will be measured.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Baseline, immediately following last treatment session, and 2-months post treatment

groups.title: Sham Group
groups.description: sham HD-tDCS for 20 minutes, meaning no stimulation.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Score on the Delis Kaplan Executive Function System (DKEFS) Semantic Fluency
outcomeMeasures.description: The DKEFS semantic verbal fluency task is a measure of language and involves 3 conditions. The subject is required to name as many animals and people names as possible within 1 minute. The outcome measure for this task is the total number of correct responses for both conditions combined, ranging from 0-90. Scores were converted to standardized scores (T-scores) using normative data, ranging from 2-86. Higher scores reflect better performance. Changes from baseline to the last HD-tDCS session and the 2-month follow-up will be measured.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Baseline, immediately following last treatment session, and 2-months post treatment

groups.title: Sham Group
groups.description:
Participants will receive sham HD-tDCS for 20 minutes, meaning no stimulation.

Sham Transcranial direct current stimulation (STARStim 8): Participants wear a neoprene cap on their head and electrodes filled with gel are attached and will deliver no current to the scalp.

groups.description:

Active Transcranial direct current stimulation (STARStim 8): Participants wear a neoprene cap on their head and electrodes filled with gel are attached and will deliver 1mA to the scalp.

groups.title: Active Stimulation at 2mA
groups.description:
Participants will receive 2 mA active HD-tDCS for 20 minutes.

Active Transcranial direct current stimulation (STARStim 8): Participants wear a neoprene cap on their head and electrodes filled with gel are attached and will deliver 2mA to the scalp.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Score on the Trail Making Test
outcomeMeasures.description: The Trail Making Test is a measure of cognitive flexibility and executive functions. The task requires the subject to as quickly as possible complete two conditions, involving number sequencing and then number-letter switching. The outcome measure for this task is the time in seconds to complete the number-letter switching condition, ranging from 15-300. Scores were converted to standardized scores (T-scores) using normative data, ranging from 2-86. Higher scores reflect better performance. Changes from baseline to the last HD-tDCS session and the 2-month follow-up will be measured.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Several participants were unable to complete the test in the administration time due to the level of cognitive impairment. Thus, the test was discontinued for many participants, prohibiting scores to be derived for several in data analysis. Scores are therefore missing for these, and the number that was able to complete the test varied across conditions and time points.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Baseline, immediately following last treatment session, and 2-months post treatment

groups.title: Sham Group
groups.description: sham HD-tDCS for 20 minutes, meaning no stimulation.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Score on the Southwestern Assessment of Processing Speed
outcomeMeasures.description: The Southwestern Assessment of Processing Speed is a measure of psychomotor processing speed. The subject is required to transcribe numbers to their corresponding written symbol as quickly as possible within 60 seconds. The outcome measure for this task is the total number of correct responses, ranging from 0-75. Scores were converted to standardized scores (T-scores) using normative data, ranging from 2-86. Higher scores reflect better performance. Changes from baseline to the last HD-tDCS session and the 2-month follow-up will be measured.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: One participant lost to follow-up. Data missing for this measure on one participant in active 2 mA group.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Baseline, immediately following last treatment session, and 2-months post treatment

groups.title: Sham Group
groups.description: sham HD-tDCS for 20 minutes, meaning no stimulation.

analyses.otherAnalysisDescription: Eta2 effect sizes produced from the pairwise comparisons were transformed to Cohen's d for examination of effect sizes. A small/weak effect size was demonstrated (Cohen's d = 0.10), when adjusting for baseline performance.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Score on the DKEFS Color-Word Interference Test
outcomeMeasures.description: The DKEFS Color-Word Interference test is a measure of information processing speed and complex attention. The task requires the subject to as quickly as possible complete four conditions, involving color naming, word reading, response inhibition, and then switching back-and-forth between two response patterns. The outcome measures for this task was the response inhibition trial and the switching trial, which are scored as the time in seconds to complete the conditions, ranging from 20-180. Scores were converted to standardized scores (T-scores) using normative data, ranging from 2-86. Higher scores reflect better performance. Changes from baseline to the last HD-tDCS session and the 2-month follow-up will be measured.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Several participants were unable to complete the test in the administration time due to the level of cognitive impairment. Thus, the test was discontinued for many participants, prohibiting scores to be derived for several in data analysis. Scores are therefore missing for these, and the number that was able to complete the test varied across conditions and time points.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Baseline, immediately following last treatment session, and 2-months post treatment

groups.title: Sham Group

adverseEventsModule.timeFrame: Adverse events were monitored from the start of assigned treatments (1 mA, 2 mA, and sham) through study completion. This involved collection of information about adverse effects daily at the beginning and end of each treatment session and then again at the 2-month visit.

eventGroups.title: Sham Group
eventGroups.description: sham HD-tDCS for 20 minutes, meaning no stimulation.

seriousEvents.notes: Patient with pre-existing cardiac condition discovered to have cardiac decline during a medical visit. Hospitalized and treated. Participant recovered well. Not considered related to the treatment protocol.

explanation_target: Reason: The intervention is high-definition transcranial direct current stimulation (HD-tDCS) — a noninvasive neuromodulation device — delivered to preSMA/dACC with the explicit aim of improving verbal episodic memory (a cognitive outcome). This is not a biologic or small-molecule drug and targets cognition rather than Alzheimer pathological proteins, so it fits the 'cognitive enhancer' category. citeturn0search0turn0search2

Act: Key trial details extracted from the description: HD-tDCS (device: STARStim/NeuroElectric StarStim) applied anodal to preSMA/dACC; two active arms (1 mA and 2 mA, 20 minutes per session) and a sham arm; 10 sessions across ~2 weeks; outcomes are verbal episodic memory measured at baseline, immediate post-treatment, and 2-month follow-up. These details support that the intended effect is cognitive enhancement via neuromodulation rather than disease-modifying pathology targeting. citeturn0search0turn0search5

Reflect: Classification check — HD-tDCS is a device-based neuromodulation intervention aimed at improving cognitive performance (verbal episodic memory). It is not a monoclonal antibody or vaccine (disease-targeted biologic), nor a small-molecule drug acting on amyloid/tau (disease-targeted small molecule), nor an intervention primarily targeting neuropsychiatric/behavioral symptoms. Therefore 'cognitive enhancer' is the correct and best-fit category. Supporting evidence that HD-tDCS to preSMA/dACC has been studied to improve verbal retrieval (in other populations) is available. citeturn0search6turn0search4

Web search results used (key pages): 1) Trial listing with study details (Noninvasive Brain Stimulation in MCI and Dementia, NCT05270408) — includes HD-tDCS, preSMA/dACC target, active 1 mA/2 mA and sham arms, 10 sessions, verbal episodic memory outcomes. citeturn0search0 2) CenterWatch / trial summary with same protocol details and sponsor info (UT Southwestern). citeturn0search2 3) Related trials/registries describing NeuroElectric StarStim HD-tDCS in similar populations and endpoints. citeturn0search5 4) PubMed evidence that 10 sessions of 1 mA anodal HD-tDCS to preSMA/dACC improved verbal retrieval in chronic TBI, supporting plausibility of cognitive effects. citeturn0search6 5) PubMed study showing HD-tDCS can enhance working memory in other settings (mechanistic/efficacy support). citeturn0search4
explanation_agent: Reason: The trial tests high-definition transcranial direct current stimulation (HD-tDCS) to preSMA/dACC with the explicit aim of improving verbal episodic memory. HD-tDCS modulates cortical excitability and neural network function to enhance cognitive performance—mechanistically this aligns with promoting synaptic plasticity/neurophysiologic modulation rather than targeting molecular AD pathology (amyloid, tau, ApoE, inflammation, etc.).

Act: Key extracted details supporting the assignment: device-based intervention (STARStim/NeuroElectric StarStim HD-tDCS), anodal stimulation to preSMA/dACC, two active currents (1 mA, 2 mA) plus sham, 20 min/session, 10 sessions over ~2 weeks, outcomes = verbal episodic memory at baseline, immediate post-treatment, 2-month follow-up. No drug, gene, or biochemical pathway is specified—therefore category is not a molecular pathology category but one addressing synaptic/network function.

Reflect: Alternative CADRO categories considered and rationale: not A) Amyloid beta or B) Tau (no amyloid/tau-targeting biologic), not C) ApoE/lipids, not F) Inflammation, etc. D) Neurotransmitter Receptors is less specific because tDCS does not directly target a single receptor class. Given the intended mechanism (modulation of excitability and plasticity) M) Synaptic Plasticity/Neuroprotection is the best-fit CADRO category. If one preferred strictly molecular targets or unknown mechanisms, S) Unknown Target could be argued, but the stated cognitive/neuromodulatory aim supports M.

Web search results / supporting pages provided in the trial description (as reported by user): 1) ClinicalTrials.gov listing: Noninvasive Brain Stimulation in MCI and Dementia (NCT05270408) — includes HD-tDCS, preSMA/dACC target, active 1 mA/2 mA and sham arms, 10 sessions, verbal episodic memory outcomes. 2) CenterWatch / trial summary with matching protocol details and sponsor (UT Southwestern). 3) Related trial/registry pages describing NeuroElectric StarStim HD-tDCS in similar populations and endpoints. 4) PubMed evidence that 10 sessions of 1 mA anodal HD-tDCS to preSMA/dACC improved verbal retrieval in chronic TBI (supports plausibility of cognitive effects). 5) PubMed study showing HD-tDCS can enhance working memory in other settings (mechanistic/efficacy support).
